original_title: Part One: Where There Is a Joyous Mood, There a Comrade Will Appear to Share a Glass of Wine
overview: 'Part One: Where There Is a Joyous Mood, There a Comrade Will Appear to Share a Glass of Wine' concerns affective relations and community building. The film is like a spell or a promise for a new and more liberating type of family structure. The film has a non-linear narrative that weaves various intimate settings, some within shared domestic spaces, others in outdoor environments. Shot in Lithuania, London, and Edinburgh, the film features the artist and her children, as well as close friends, which she considers extended family.
title: Part One: Where There Is a Joyous Mood, There a Comrade Will Appear to Share a Glass of Wine
